snippet: The data showing a jobless rate of 11.4 percent overall in the euro area in August underscores that the European recession is deepening, analysts said.
abstract: Eurostat reports unemployment in the euro zone reached a record 11.4 percent in August, and revises figures for June and July to 11.4 percent; analysts say data underscores that European recession is deepening.

byline.original: By DAVID JOLLY and RAPHAEL MINDER
byline.contributor: David Jolly reported from Paris and Raphael Minder from Madrid. James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: The data showing a jobless rate of 11.4 percent overall in the euro area in August underscores that the European recession is deepening, analysts said.

headline.seo: Unemployment in Euro Zone at Record 11.4%
headline.main: Unemployment in Euro Zone at Record High
headline.print_headline: Jobless Rate at Record 11.4% in Euro Zone, Suggesting Deepening Recession
